docs.snippet: According to James Uleman, PhD, a psychology professor at New York University and researcher on impression management, “In spite of the congeniality of many professional gatherings, judgments are being made and impressions formed at all time...

headline.main: Modern Etiquette: At Business Meetings, Impressions Are Important
headline.print_headline: Modern Etiquette: At Business Meetings, Impressions Are Important

docs.lead_paragraph: According to James Uleman, PhD, a psychology professor at New York University and researcher on impression management, “In spite of the congeniality of many professional gatherings, judgments are being made and impressions formed at all times.”

docs.snippet: Directors at London-listed blue-chip companies earned 21 percent more in the 2013/14 financial year thanks to a steep rise in long-term incentives, a report showed on Monday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Directors at London-listed blue-chip companies earned 21 percent more in the 2013/14 financial year thanks to a steep rise in long-term incentives, a report showed on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British government plans to sell its 40 percent stake in the fast-speed Eurostar train operator that links Britain with the European continent, Chancellor George Osborne announced late on Sunday.

docs.snippet: Euro zone banks have raised 35 percent more capital ahead of the European Central Bank's (ECB) latest stress test than they had set aside before the 2011 review, according to a report published by law firm Linklaters....

headline.print_headline: European Banks Raise More Capital Before ECB Stress Test: Report

docs.lead_paragraph: Euro zone banks have raised 35 percent more capital ahead of the European Central Bank's (ECB) latest stress test than they had set aside before the 2011 review, according to a report published by law firm Linklaters.

docs.snippet: France and Italy will keep pressure on Germany this week to use government money to revive the euro zone's stagnating economy but in a sign of inertia, a promised list of projects to create growth will not be ready until December....

headline.main: Euro Zone Seeks to Soften German Opposition to Stimulus Spending
headline.print_headline: Euro Zone Seeks to Soften German Opposition to Stimulus Spending

docs.lead_paragraph: France and Italy will keep pressure on Germany this week to use government money to revive the euro zone's stagnating economy but in a sign of inertia, a promised list of projects to create growth will not be ready until December.

docs.snippet: Nationalists with little shared vision of Bosnia's future were in the lead in an election for the three-person presidency on Sunday, likely portending more dysfunction in a country still haunted by the divisions of a 1992-95 war....

docs.lead_paragraph: Nationalists with little shared vision of Bosnia's future were in the lead in an election for the three-person presidency on Sunday, likely portending more dysfunction in a country still haunted by the divisions of a 1992-95 war.

headline.main: Michigan's Only Gubernatorial Debate Grows Testy
headline.print_headline: Michigan's Only Gubernatorial Debate Grows Testy

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Gov. Rick Snyder appealed for a second term during a debate Sunday by pointing to Michigan's economic turnaround and Detroit's progress toward emerging from bankruptcy, while Democratic challenger Mark Schauer accused Snyder of cutting education funding and criticized him for raising taxes on retirees.
